topic.title: Complete List of Synopsys Bridge Arguments

body.p: This page lists all the arguments that Synopsys Bridge supports. Arguments can be passed thru environment variables, command line or a JSON file.We recommend that you pass sensitive information such as access tokens using environment variables.
For a list of arguments that are common to all Synopsys security products, refer to below.
For product specific arguments, refer to the product specific section below:

section.title: Universal Synopsys Bridge Arguments
section.p: These arguments can be passed on the command line, but not as part of a JSON file.

row.entry: The --stage command specifies a group of adapters to run (such as --stage polaris).
The --input command loads a JSON file containing common arguments to run scans
Required for inputting a JSON files.
Shows the help file for Synopsys Bridge.
Outputs JSON format logs. See Logging and Diagnostics.
Outputs JSON format logs in the bridge.log file in the Synopsys Bridge home directory. See Logging and Diagnostics.
Specifies a specific version of Synopsys Bridge to run.

Enables debug logs under the Synopsys Bridge home directory. Creates a diagnostics.json file containing the final state data inside the Synopsys Bridge home directory, but masking sensitive information like tokens and passwords. See Logging and Diagnostics.

section.title: Polaris

row.entry: For security reasons, it is recommended that you pass this as an environment variable.
Application must be created on Polaris, and have right entitlements.
The specified project must exist on Polaris. If you set polaris.onboarding totrue, Synopsys Bridge will automatically create the project in case it doesn’t yet exist on Polaris.
Comma separated values. Accepted values SAST or SCA or SAST, SCA.
Directory to which Bridge downloads the underlying scan tools. Defaults to <User>/.bridge.
If set to true, Bridge will attempt to create the project on Polaris if it does not exist. Default is false.
If you are entitled to the Auto-Triage feature on Polaris, you can use this option to enable the feature. Possible values are REQUIRED, NOT_REQUIRED and NOT_ENTITLED.

section.p: Here are the commands to run: export BRIDGE_POLARIS_ACCESSTOKEN=<POLARIS_ACCESSTOKEN> synopsys-bridge --stage Polaris --input input.json

section.title: Black Duck
section.p: The base command to run the scan:synopsys-bridge --stage blackduck

row.entry:
Performs a full/intelligent scan when set to true. Required and used for scanning based on SCM push events.
Performs a rapid scan when set to false . Required for SCM pull request events. true or false. (Default: false).

entry.p: Path to directory where detect.jar resides.
Used by Bridge to determine whether to break the build or not.
If provided, Bridge will break the build and returns exit code.
If set to true, Bridge creates fix pull requests for vulnerable direct dependencies. (Default: false)
Note: Currently only NPM is supports.
Note: Requires SCM information including token as documented in section SCM Information needed for “Creating Fix Pull Requests” feature below.

row.entry:
If set to true , Bridge adds comments to pull requests for new issues introduced in the pull request. Note: Requires Rapid Scan to be run on pull require events. This argument is ignored if full scan is run.
Note: Requires SCM information including token as documented in section SCM Information needed for "Adding Comments to Pull Requests" feature below.

p.b: SCM Information needed for “Creating Fix Pull Requests” feature

section.p: To use this feature, you must pass the following SCM arguments.

p.b: SCM Information needed for “Adding Comments to Pull Requests” feature

section.p: Here are the commands to run:export BRIDGE_BLACKDUCK_TOKEN=<BLACKDUCK_TOKEN> synopsys-bridge --stage blackduck --input input.json

section.title: Coverity Connect

row.entry: For security reasons it is recommended to pass this as an environmental variable.
For security reasons it is recommended to pass this as an environmental variable.
Project must exist on Coverity Instance
Stream must exist on Coverity Instance.

entry.p: Bridge will break the build if issues are found in the view provided by user and returns exit code .
If set to true , Bridge adds comments to pull requests for new issues introduced in the pull request.
Requires Rapid Scan to be run on pull require events. This argument is ignored if full scan is run.
Note: Requires SCM information including token as documented in section SCM Information needed for “Adding Comments to Pull Requests” feature.
Path to directory where coverity resides. Default: <$HOME>/.bridge/coverity.

row.entry:
To use Synopsys Bridge with on-prem Coverity Connect, set this to true. When set to true, Bridge will download full analysis kit and will perform capture and analysis locally.
With Coverity cloud deployments, Synopsys uses Thin Client and this option should be set to false.
Default: false.

p.note: To use Synopsys Bridge with on-prem Coverity Connect, you must set the coverity.local to true as described above.

section.p: Here is a sample input.json file that can be used with Coverity Cloud:
Here are the commands to run:export BRIDGE_COVERITY_CONNECT_USER_NAME=<COV_USER> export BRIDGE_COVERITY_CONNECT_USER_PASSWORD=<COVERITY_PASSPHRASE> synopsys-bridge --stage connect --input input.json
